[[File:Eric David Anderson - Michel Delv: '''Michel Delving''' was the chief town of [[the Shire]].  It was located in the [[White Downs]] that lay within the [[Westfarthing]] on the [[East Road]], perhaps south to its smaller counterpart, the [[Little Delving]].<ref>{{FR
thumb: Part}}</ref>  Although located within a hilly region the town had many above-ground houses of wood, brick, or stone.

[[File:Eric David Anderson - Michel Delv: This large town was unofficially considered to be more or less the Hobbits' "capital".<ref name=Hobbits>{{FR
thumb: Hobbits}}</ref>  The [[Mayor of Michel Delving]] (or of the Shire) was the only real official in the Shire, under whom were attached the offices of [[Postmaster]] and [[First Shirriff]] for the entire region.<ref>{{FR
I9}}</ref>, the museum known as the [[Mathom-house]]<ref name=Hobbits/>, as well as the storage tunnels later known as [[Lockholes]]<ref>{{RK
[[Eric David Anderson]] - ''Michel Delvi: Scouring}}</ref>, could be found in Michel Delving.

thumb: 3019}} [[Frodo Baggins]] rode to Michel Delving and released the prisoners from the Lockholes.<ref>{{RK
